title: Functions and Recursion
concept: This level focuses on writing and using functions in C, including functions with parameters, return values, and simple recursion. Problems are adapted from Snakify function and recursion tasks.

challenges.title: Distance Between Two Points
challenges.description: Write a function double distance(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2) that returns the distance between (x1, y1) and (x2, y2). In main(), read four real numbers and print the distance.
challenges.inputDescription: Four real numbers x1, y1, x2, y2.
challenges.outputDescription: One real number: distance between the points.

challenges.title: Power Function (Iterative)
challenges.description: Write a function double power(double a, int n) that returns a^n using a loop (n may be negative, zero or positive). Do not use pow from math library inside the function.
challenges.inputDescription: Real number a and integer n.

challenges.title: Capitalize Words
challenges.description: Write a function void capitalize(char s[]) that changes the string so that the first letter of each word is uppercase (words separated by single spaces). Read one line in main, call capitalize, then print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: One line: a sentence in lowercase.
challenges.outputDescription: Same sentence with each word capitalized.
examples:
Input:
hello world from c

Output:
Hello World From C

challenges.title: Recursive Power
challenges.description: Write a recursive function double powerRec(double a, int n) that returns a^n using relation a^n = a * a^(n-1). Handle n = 0 as base case (a^0 = 1). Assume n >= 0.

challenges.title: Fibonacci (Recursive)
challenges.description: Write a function long long fib(int n) that returns the n-th Fibonacci number using recursion. Use definition: fib(0)=0, fib(1)=1, fib(n)=fib(n-1)+fib(n-2). Assume 0 <= n <= 30.

challenges.title: Reverse Sequence (Recursive)
challenges.description: Given a sequence of integers ending with 0, print the sequence in reverse order using recursion and without arrays.
challenges.inputDescription: Integers, one per line, ending with 0.
challenges.outputDescription: Same integers (excluding 0) in reverse order, each on new line.

challenges.title: Fibonacci (Iterative Function)
challenges.description: Write a function long long fibIter(int n) that returns the n-th Fibonacci number using a loop (iterative). Assume 0 <= n <= 50.

challenges.title: Distinct Count Using Function
challenges.description: Write a function int countDistinct(int a[], int n) that returns how many distinct integers are in the array. In main, read n and the array, call the function and print the result.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer n followed by n integers.

challenges.title: Max of Array Using Function
challenges.description: Write a function int maxArray(int a[], int n) that returns the maximum value of an array. In main, read n and the array, then print the maximum.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer n followed by n integers.

challenges.title: Is Number in List (Function)
challenges.description: Write a function int contains(int a[], int n, int x) that returns 1 if x is present in the array, else 0. In main, read n, array, and x, then print YES or NO.
challenges.inputDescription: Integer n, then n integers, then integer x.
challenges.outputDescription: YES if x exists in the array, otherwise NO.
